block.p: Miriam Beth Gottesfeld and Joshua Bruce Fine were married last evening by Rabbi Jacob Lantz at the Silvermine Tavern in Norwalk, Conn.

Mrs. Fine, 31, is a lawyer at the Metropolitan Life Insurance Company in New York. She graduated from Middlebury College and the University of Pennsylvania School of Law. She is a daughter of Elise and Stanley Gottesfeld of Chappaqua, N.Y. Her father retired as a marketing manager in White Plains for I.B.M.
Miriam Beth Gottesfeld and Joshua Bruce Fine were married last evening by Rabbi Jacob Lantz at the Silvermine Tavern in Norwalk, Conn.

Mrs. Fine, 31, is a lawyer at the Metropolitan Life Insurance Company in New York. She graduated from Middlebury College and the University of Pennsylvania School of Law. She is a daughter of Elise and Stanley Gottesfeld of Chappaqua, N.Y. Her father retired as a marketing manager in White Plains for I.B.M.

Mr. Fine, 39, is the director of educational services at Microedge, a computer software company in New York. He is also an adjunct instructor of computer technology and applications at the school of continuing education of Columbia University in New York. He graduated from Indiana University and the University of Bridgeport School of Law. He is a son of Diane and Leonard Fine of Norwalk. His father is a professor of chemistry and the director of undergraduate studies in chemistry at Columbia.
